Note: Tables change to an accordion display on small screens, which can make things a little tricky when laying out content. This is how it works:

Each row (tr) becomes a separate accordion.

The first cell (td) of each row becomes the accordion header.

The remaining cells (td) of each row become the accordion content.

If the cell has a corresponding table heading (th), it will display as a small heading above that cell.

Using the right example's first row:

"Image" (the first cell td of the row) will be the accordion heading.

The two images (the remaining cells td of the row) will become the accordion content.

The first image will have a heading of "Simple CWP" & the second image will have a heading of "Complex CWP (Progressive Massive Fibrosis)" (their corresponding table headings th)

2c. Table

Simple CWP Complex CWP (Progressive Massive Fibrosis)
Image

Symptoms
  • May have no symptoms
  • May have mild like chronic cough or occasional shortness of breath
  • Shortness of breath on exertion and eventually at rest
  • Chronic cough, black sputum, lung dysfunction, pulmonary hypertension and heart problems
  • Emphysema
  • Chronic chest infections

Biology
  • small nodules in lung tissue (called coal macules) 1-2 mm in size – hard to differentiate from blood vessels in X-ray
  • The nodules join together, creating large areas of fibrosis
  • Areas of fibrosis fuse and block the lung vessels, eventually them to die (necrosis)

2d. Table with coloured cells

Spirometry Chest X-Ray Other symptoms Result
Normal (above 80%) Normal none No action required
Reduced to between 70% and 80% n/a n/a Book an additional health assessment in 12 months to review spirometry
Reduced below 80% n/a n/a Referral to NMA for further assessment
n/a Chest X-ray shows signs of CWP in comparison to ILO standard n/a Referral to NMA for further assessment

Note: Use this to lay out content easily in a grid-like format. You can use as many flex items as you like.

Add class="full" to a flex item on any variation to make it full-width.

Note that the borders have only been added here for demonstration purposes.

3. Layout

Underneath the main element you can use section elements with different classes to align content left, right or center. The following examples have borders for demonstration purposes.

3a. section--center

A centered section that spans 8 columns. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc eu tincidunt felis. Quisque dictum, purus non consequat fermentum, lorem nulla dictum elit, ac vulputate magna nisl eget risus. Cras mollis quam id augue ullamcorper dapibus ut nec lacus. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus.

3b. section--center (variation: centered text)

A centered section that spans 8 columns, with centered text. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc eu tincidunt felis. Quisque dictum, purus non consequat fermentum, lorem nulla dictum elit, ac vulputate magna nisl eget risus. Cras mollis quam id augue ullamcorper dapibus ut nec lacus. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus.

3c. section--left

.section--left__content

This is a basic example of a left section with a content div & a sidebar div. Further down will provide examples of how sidebars can be positioned.

.section--left__sidebar

This is a sidebar, it's optional.

3d. section--right

.section--right__sidebar

This is a sidebar, it's optional.

.section--right__content

This is a basic example of a right section with a content div & a sidebar div. Note that for the right section, the sidebar div is placed before the content div in the html. Further down will provide examples of how sidebars can be positioned.

3e. section--left with sidebar positioning

.section--left__content

If you want to position a sidebar further down along the section, to line up with a particular piece of content, simply create multiple content & sidebar divs. Think of each content div as starting a new row. They will grow to fit eachother's height.

.section--left__content

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

.section--left__sidebar

Cras mollis quam id augue ullamcorper dapibus ut nec lacus. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus.

3f. section--right with sidebar positioning

.section--right__content

For the right hand side it works the same -- except the sidebar div is placed before the content divs in the html.

.section--right__sidebar

This is a sidebar, it's optional.

.section--right__content

3h. Header classes explained

Header (default)

This is the default header. It begins with a transparent background & changes to a white background on scroll.

Header (variation: light)

This behaves the same as the default header, except uses white text. Use this one if the video hero image is really dark.

Header (variation: no hero)

Always has a white background. Use this one if there's no video hero. Note that a class is also added to the pre-header for this one.

3i. Video section

Below is the entire video & transcript section for you to copy. This needs to be placed above the main element. Please use the iframe as below & only change the URL.

For the hero image, this needs to be set as a background image in the css. If you find/search for $video section" on the style.css (or _elements.scss if you choose to use SASS) file you will find it there.

4. Extra notes

Feel free to use the files however you like & the /dist directory has all the final files.

CSS & JS has a table of contents and you can search for sections with a $ in front of them. E.G. search for "$header" to find the header.

If you need to change JS or CSS without SASS

The site is using minified CSS & JS but I've provided un-compressed versions if you'd like them.

dist/css/style.css is the full-version CSS

dist/js/script.js is the full-version JS

There's a gulp workflow if you'd like it

If it's useful for you, there is a full Gulp & SASS set up. It compiles SASS, runs autoprefixer & runs babel. It pulls everything from /src and puts it in /dist.

To get set up, assuming you have node & npm installed:

1. In root directory, run 'npm install --save-dev'

2. Run 'gulp'

Or if you just want to use the SASS without gulp

You can find it in src/sass
